steps.instruction: Make coffee bloom.
steps.name: Blooming

steps.instruction: Drip water until reach target amount
steps.name: Pour 1

steps.instruction: Drip water until reach target amount
steps.name: Pour 2

steps.instruction: Drip water until reach target amount
steps.name: Pour 3

name: Orkun Ustel 4X60
description: It is used as a reference recipe by Orkun Üstel. Orkun brews using this recipe in the recipes on his Youtube channel.

steps.instruction: Make coffee bloom. Between 10s - 15s swirl gently.
steps.name: Blooming

steps.instruction: Drip water until 100g of water.
steps.name: Pour 50g water.

steps.instruction: Wait dripping water.
steps.name: Wait

steps.instruction: Drip water until 150g of water.
steps.name: Pour 50g water.

steps.instruction: Wait dripping water.
steps.name: Wait

steps.instruction: Drip water until 200g of water.
steps.name: Pour 50g water.

steps.instruction: Wait dripping water.
steps.name: Wait

steps.instruction: Drip water until 250g of water.
steps.name: Pour 50g water.

steps.instruction: Gently Swirl
steps.name: Swirl

steps.instruction: Drawdown should finish around 3:00, but expect some variance here. Taste is the most important thing!
steps.name: Wait Drawdown

name: James Hoffman - A Better 1 Cup
description: James says, this is really fun, really easy and it gives delicious coffee receipe. Used fresh boiled water. Grind Settings: Medium - Fine (finer than general V60 grind settings).

steps.instruction: Make coffee bloom. Pour hot water in a continuous circular motion, moving from the centre point into a wider circle
steps.name: Blooming

steps.instruction: Drip water until 120g of water.
steps.name: Pour 60g water.

steps.instruction: Wait dripping water.
steps.name: Wait

steps.instruction: Drip water until 180g of water.
steps.name: Pour 60g water.

steps.instruction: Wait dripping water.
steps.name: Wait

steps.instruction: Drip water until 240g of water.
steps.name: Pour 60g water.

steps.instruction: Wait dripping water.
steps.name: Wait

steps.instruction: Drip water until 300g of water.
steps.name: Pour 60g water.

steps.instruction: Drawdown should finish around 3:30.
steps.name: Wait Drawdown

name: Matt Winton - Five Pour Receipe
description: Matt Winton is 2021 World Brewers Cup Shampion. Matt shares the recipe that won him the title of World Champion! He using 93 celcius water and coarser grind. And, he strongly recommend metal Hario V60. Also, he waits until the water flows drop by drop and then starts the next water pour. We found that 20 seconds was enough for the water to flow drop by drop. If your water flows fast, you can go for finer grinding.

name: Scott Rao’s V60 – Spin to Win
description: Scott Rao “strongly recommends” the plastic V60, which maintains the heat of the brew and allows you to manipulate the funnel during the brew without burning yourself.

steps.name: Blooming
steps.instruction: Pour in grounds, flatten, pre-wet with 66g water. Gently excavate to wet all the grounds within 10s

steps.name: Start main pour until 360g.
steps.instruction: Gently stir to stop grounds from clinging to sides

steps.name: Swirl V60 to flatten coffee bed for even brew.
steps.instruction: Drawdown should be complete within 3 minutes.

name: The Ultimate V60 – James Hoffman
description: James Hoffman recommends the plastic V60, but personally uses the Hario Drip Decanter, a glass carafe with a plastic insert. Hoffman also emphasises using a pouring kettle for maximum heat, using soft, pleasant-tasting water, and a high-quality burr grinder for consistent grounds.

steps.name: Blooming
steps.instruction: First rinse filter and pre-heat V60. Then, pour in grounds, pre-wet with 60g water. Swirl brewer until the slurry is even.

steps.name: Start main pour until 300g.
steps.instruction: Complete the first main pour till 300g in the next 30s.

steps.name: Start main pour until 500g.
steps.instruction: Gently complete second main pour till 500g in the next 30s

steps.name: Stir gently and wait drawdown
steps.instruction: Stir gently clockwise and anticlockwise to kick grounds from the sides. Gently swirl brewer to flatten coffee bed for even extraction. Aim to finish drawdown by 3min 30s.

name: Tetsu Kasuya’s Advanced 4:6 Method
description: Sweet and elegant. Enjoy a juicy brew that stimulates your salivary glands! Use coarse grind size.

steps.name: Blooming
steps.instruction: Pour 100g of hot water in a continuous circular motion, moving from the centre point into a wider circle and then back to the centre point. Complete this pour in 10 seconds, then pause.

steps.name: Start main pour until 240gr.
steps.instruction: Pour the rest of the brew with the same spiral motion, taking special care to avoid pouring on the filter paper itself.

steps.name: Pour until 360gr.
steps.instruction: Pour the rest of the brew with the same spiral motion, taking special care to avoid pouring on the filter paper itself.

steps.name: Pour until 480gr.
steps.instruction: Pour the rest of the brew with the same spiral motion, taking special care to avoid pouring on the filter paper itself.

steps.name: Pour until 600gr.
steps.instruction: After pour, wait drawdown and aim to finish drawdown by 3min 30s.

name: Intelligentsia Coffee Receipt
description:
A veritable third-wave coffee pioneer, the US-based Intelligentsia Coffee consistently makes local and international best-of lists and is home to award-winning baristas. 
 Grind Size: Fine

steps.name: Blooming
steps.instruction: Add 52g (2x weight of grounds) of water for pre-wetting. Pour in a clockwise spiral outward from the centre. Wait ~1 min.

steps.name: Start main pour until 130gr.
steps.instruction: Add water 80g of water a time, waiting 10-12s between pours. Pours should be slow enough that the water falls directly downward, and concentrated in the centre of the coffee bed, moving outward.

steps.name: Pour until 210gr.
steps.instruction: Add water 80g of water a time, waiting 10-12s between pours. Pours should be slow enough that the water falls directly downward, and concentrated in the centre of the coffee bed, moving outward.

steps.name: Pour until 290gr.
steps.instruction: Add water 80g of water a time, waiting 10-12s between pours. Pours should be slow enough that the water falls directly downward, and concentrated in the centre of the coffee bed, moving outward.

steps.name: Pour until 370gr.
steps.instruction: Add water 80g of water a time, waiting 10-12s between pours. Pours should be slow enough that the water falls directly downward, and concentrated in the centre of the coffee bed, moving outward.

steps.name: Pour until 450gr.
steps.instruction: Add water 80g of water a time, waiting 10-12s between pours. After pour, wait drawdown and aim to finish drawdown by 3min 30s.

steps.name: Blooming
steps.instruction: First rinse filter and pre-heat V60. Then, pour boiling water from the centre of the grounds, spiralling outwards. Let it pre-wet for 30s

steps.name: Start main pour until 120g.
steps.instruction: Pour the rest of the brew with the same spiral motion, taking special care to avoid pouring on the filter paper itself.

steps.name: Wait drawdown
steps.instruction: Remove the dripper once your brew is finished.
